title: Front-End Development at Similie
subtitle: About Project
body:
I have had the privilege of serving as a Front-End Developer at Similie since October 2018. Over the years, I have evolved into a dynamic and proficient front-end developer, contributing significantly to the success of Similie.


My work at Similie has underscored my commitment to delivering high-quality front-end solutions and my ability to adapt to evolving design and development requirements.


I took on a leading role within the company and demonstrated a meticulous, action-oriented approach. I proactively initiated projects, collaborated with team members, and established well-defined paths for execution and accountability.

subContent.title: Complete Redesign
subContent.subtext: One of my major achievements was the complete redesign and implementation of the front-end experience for Similie's flagship product, Parabl. This project involved reworking a complex application codebase with years of legacy code, showcasing my ability to tackle significant challenges.

subContent2.title: Organized Styles System with BEM Methodology
subContent2.subtext: I implemented the BEM (Block, Element, Modifier) methodology to create a highly organized UI component system. This approach ensured the maintainability and scalability of our front-end codebase, resulting in streamlined development processes.

subContent3.title: Theme Customization
subContent3.subtext: As part of my contributions, I introduced a dynamic theming feature that allowed users to switch between Light and Dark themes effortlessly. This enhancement provided users with a more personalized and visually pleasing experience.

title: Front-End Development at Payever
subtitle: About Project
body:
In my role as a Front-End Developer at Payever, I had the opportunity to work on complex applications using Angular 6.


I contributed significantly to the success of our projects and improve the overall user experience. My dedication to code quality and innovative solutions positively impacted the team's productivity and the satisfaction of our end-users.

subContent.title: Angular 6 Development
subContent.subtext: I was heavily involved in the development of complex web applications using Angular 6, leveraging its capabilities to create robust and responsive user interfaces.

subContent2.title: UI Component Development
subContent2.subtext: I took ownership of developing UI components based on our custom UI-kit system. This allowed us to consistently deliver the best user experience to our customers by ensuring a cohesive and visually appealing design across our applications.

subContent3.title: Code Reviews and Quality Assurance
subContent3.subtext: I played a key role in maintaining code quality by conducting thorough code reviews. This ensured consistency in coding standards and optimized the style system for better maintainability.

title: E-commerce Website for DMDBrand
subtitle: About Project
body: I've received a request to build a website for exclusive dresses and costumes. Because some pages have unconventional layouts, we've opted to use WordPress + WooCommerce.

subContent.title: Clean And Simple Design
subContent.subtext: The photos provided by the client are vivid and vibrant. Therefore, it was crucial to create a minimalist design. Since the primary focus was on the photos, a masonry grid layout was employed.

subContent2.title: User Friendly Shop
subContent2.subtext: The website offers the option to make payments and purchase dresses, so there is a 'shop' section available.

subContent3.title: Responsive
subContent3.subtext: The website is fully responsive and adapted for all devices.

title: Mobile App for Namogoo
subtitle: About Project
body:
When I worked at CodersClan, I was tasked with creating a mobile application for a some special event.


The application is essentially a roulette wheel that awards prizes with a specific probability.


The application was built using Cordova.

subContent.title: Roulette Animation.
subContent.subtext: The most challenging aspect of the application was the roulette wheel animation.

subContent2.title: Hidden Application Settings
subContent2.subtext: The application includes a hidden admin panel for configuring general application settings and generating a file with collected contact information.

subContent3.title: Prize Generation Settings.
subContent3.subtext: The application also has a hidden admin panel for prize generation settings.

title: Informational Website for BYouFit
subtitle: About Project
body:
I received a request to create a website for a company that specializes in delivering healthy food.


The website displays information about the existing delivery options, the advantages of working with the company, and contact information.

subContent.title: Branding Style
subContent.subtext: The website is designed in the company's style. Green colors dominate the site, which best suits the theme.

subContent2.title: Trial Week
subContent2.subtext: It was decided to add a promotion with a trial week so that customers have the opportunity to try the delivery at an enticing price.

subContent3.title: FAQ
subContent3.subtext: It was important to include a FAQ section with answers to frequently asked questions to make it easier for potential customers to make a decision to place an order.

title: Corporate Website for GlobalS
subtitle: About Project
body:
I received a request to create a website for the company Globals.


The company is represented in two countries: the UAE and Lebanon. Therefore, it was important to provide contact information for both countries.


The website consists of 4 pages: Home, which provides general information about the company, and three other pages for services (Food Safety, Catering, and Cleaning).

subContent.title: Brand Identity
subContent.subtext: It was important for the client to preserve the brand identity. Therefore, the company's logo was added as a pattern to the background.

subContent2.title: Services
subContent2.subtext: There are links to individual service pages from the homepage. Each page has a primary color corresponding to the colors used in all other printed marketing materials of the company.

subContent3.title: Responsive
subContent3.subtext: The website is fully responsive and adapted for all devices.

title: Wordress Template for Namogoo Virtual Summit
subtitle: About Project
body: When I worked at CodersClan, I was tasked with creating a WordPress template for an Israel eCommerce Innovation Virtual Summit.

subContent.title: Pixel Perfect Implementation.
subContent.subtext: The design had a unique design that was implemented on the website perfectly.

subContent2.title: Animation Implementation.
subContent2.subtext: The website featured animations that were seamlessly integrated into the site.

subContent3.title: WordPress Template.
subContent3.subtext: The backend was built using WordPress, allowing the client to easily modify the content on the pages.

title: E-commerce Website for Ansora
subtitle: Awesome portfolio
body:
In a typical React application, data is passed top-down (parent to child) via props, but such usage can be cumbersome for certain types of props (e.g. locale preference, UI theme).


that are required by many components within an application. Context provides a way to share values like these between components without having to explicitly pass a prop through every level of the tree.
